info.name: DummyJSON Automation
info.description: # üöÄ DummyJSON API Automation Framework de automa√ß√£o de testes de API REST desenvolvido para validar endpoints do [DummyJSON](https://dummyjson.com). O projeto utiliza **Postman** para estrutura√ß√£o dos cen√°rios e **Newman** para execu√ß√£o em pipeline (CI/CD) com relat√≥rios HTML avan√ßados. ## üìã Arquitetura e Funcionalidades O projeto foi desenhado para simular fluxos reais de um Backend, cobrindo autentica√ß√£o, manipula√ß√£o de dados e valida√ß√£o de contratos. ### Destaques T√©cnicos: - **üîê Autentica√ß√£o Din√¢mica (JWT):** O token gerado no login √© capturado automaticamente e injetado em todos os requests subsequentes via Vari√°veis de Ambiente. - **üîÑ Fluxos CRUD Inteligentes:** - **Cria√ß√£o:** Captura o ID gerado pela API. - **Persist√™ncia Simulada:** Tratamento l√≥gico para lidar com o Mock do DummyJSON (uso de IDs est√°ticos para Update/Delete garantirem sucesso). - **Valida√ß√£o Cruzada:** O endpoint `/auth/me` valida se o token gerado pertence realmente ao usu√°rio logado. - **üìú Contract Testing:** Valida√ß√£o de **JSON Schema** em todos os endpoints para garantir a integridade dos tipos de dados. - **‚ö° Performance:** Monitoramento global de SLA (tempo de resposta < 2000ms) em toda a cole√ß√£o. ## üß™ Cobertura de Testes A cole√ß√£o est√° organizada em pastas l√≥gicas: 1. **Auth** - Login (POST) - Valida√ß√£o de Token/Sess√£o (GET /auth/me) 2. **Products (CRUD)** - Adicionar Produto (POST) - Atualizar Produto (PUT) - Remover Produto (DELETE) 3. **Users (CRUD)** - Adicionar Usu√°rio (POST) - Atualizar Usu√°rio (PUT) - Remover Usu√°rio (DELETE) ## ‚öôÔ∏è Pr√©-requisitos - [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) (v14 ou superior) - Newman (CLI do Postman) - Newman Reporter HTML Extra ## üöÄ Instala√ß√£o e Execu√ß√£o ### 1\. Instalar Depend√™ncias No terminal, instale o Newman e o gerador de relat√≥rios globalmente: ``` bash npm install -g newman newman-reporter-htmlextra ``` ### 2\. Exportar Arquivos Exporte sua Collection e seu Environment do Postman e salve na pasta do projeto: - `DummyJSON Automation.postman_collection.json` - `DummyJSON - QA.postman_environment.json` ### 3\. Executar os Testes Rode o comando abaixo para executar a su√≠te completa e gerar o dashboard: ``` bash newman run "DummyJSON Automation.postman_collection.json" \ -e "DummyJSON - QA.postman_environment.json" \ -r htmlextra ``` ## üìä Relat√≥rios Ap√≥s a execu√ß√£o, um relat√≥rio detalhado ser√° gerado na pasta `/newman`. Abra o arquivo `.html` no seu navegador para visualizar: - Dashboard com gr√°ficos de Pass/Fail. - Detalhamento de Request/Response Headers e Body. - Logs de testes ignorados ou falhos. --- **Author:** Christian Sperb

request.description:
## Login

Authenticate a user and retrieve access and refresh tokens.

### Endpoint
- Method: POST
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/auth/login`

### Authorization
- None required for this endpoint.
- On success, tokens are returned. The access token can be stored in the environment as `token` for subsequent requests.

### Request
- Headers:
  - `Content-Type: application/json`
- Body (raw JSON):
```json
{
  "username": "string",
  "password": "string"
}
```

Example:
```json
{
  "username": "emilys",
  "password": "emilyspass"
}
```

### Variables
- `{{baseUrl}}`: Base URL for the DummyJSON API (set in the active environment).

### Responses
- 200 OK
  - Returns user info and tokens. Example shape:
```json
{
  "accessToken": "<jwt>",
  "refreshToken": "<jwt>",
  "id": 1,
  "username": "emilys",
  "email": "emily.johnson@x.dummyjson.com",
  "firstName": "Emily",
  "lastName": "Johnson",
  "gender": "female",
  "image": "https://dummyjson.com/icon/emilys/128"
}
```
- 400/401
  - Returned when credentials are invalid or missing.

### Tests
This request contains tests that assert a 200 status code and check for presence of token and id fields. On success, it stores:
- `token`: Access token returned by the API (environment variable)
- `userId`: User id returned by the API (environment variable)

Note: If the API returns `accessToken` instead of `token`, update the test to assert `accessToken` and set `token` from that value if needed.

### Usage Notes
- Use the returned `accessToken`/`token` as a Bearer token for authenticated endpoints.
- Keep `refreshToken` safely to renew sessions when required.

request.description:
# Verifies the bearer token by fetching the authenticated user profile.

## Endpoint

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/auth/me
    

## Authentication

- Requires Bearer Token in Authorization header: `Authorization: Bearer {{token}}`
    
- Uses {{token}} from the active environment.
    

## Expected Response

- Status: 200 on success
    
- Body: JSON object with user profile fields including id, username, email, image, role, and other attributes.
    

## Tests (post-response)

- Confirms the token belongs to the expected user by comparing response `id` to `{{userId}}` and checking `username` equals `emilys`.
    
- Validates presence of profile fields: `email` and `image`.
    

## Variables

- {{baseUrl}}: Base URL for the DummyJSON API.
    
- {{token}}: Bearer token for the authenticated session.
    
- {{userId}}: Expected authenticated user id used in tests.
    

## Usage Notes

- Ensure the active environment (e.g., DummyJSON - QA) has valid values for baseUrl, token, and userId before sending.
    
- This request has no body.

request.description:
# Add Product

## Summary

Creates a new product in the DummyJSON sample API for QA automation exercises. This request uses environment variables for base URL and auth token.

## Endpoint

POST {{baseUrl}}/products/add

## Authentication

- Bearer Token (recommended)
    - Uses environment variable: {{token}}
        

## Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    
- Authorization: Bearer {{token}} (if required by your environment)
    

## Request Body

Content-Type: application/json  
Schema (representative)  
{  
"type": "object",  
"required": \["title", "price", "stock", "brand", "category"\],  
"properties": {  
"title": { "type": "string", "example": "Celular de Teste QA" },  
"description": { "type": "string", "example": "Um smartphone criado via automa√ß√£o Postman" },  
"price": { "type": "number", "example": 999 },  
"discountPercentage": { "type": "number", "example": 0 },  
"rating": { "type": "number", "example": 5 },  
"stock": { "type": "integer", "example": 50 },  
"brand": { "type": "string", "example": "QA Brand" },  
"category": { "type": "string", "example": "smartphones" }  
}  
}

## Example Body

{  
"title": "Celular de Teste QA",  
"description": "Um smartphone criado via automa√ß√£o Postman",  
"price": 999,  
"rating": 5,  
"stock": 50,  
"brand": "QA Brand",  
"category": "smartphones"  
}

## Success Responses

- 201 Created (or 200 OK in DummyJSON mock behavior)  
    Body (example)  
    {  
    "id": 195,  
    "title": "Celular de Teste QA",  
    "description": "Um smartphone criado via automa√ß√£o Postman",  
    "price": 999,  
    "rating": 5,  
    "stock": 50,  
    "brand": "QA Brand",  
    "category": "smartphones"  
    }
    

## Error Responses

- 400 Bad Request: Invalid or missing fields.
    
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid token when auth is enforced.
    

## Notes

- This workspace uses an automation-friendly flow. The post-response tests validate status (200/201) and contract via JSON schema and store a productId environment variable set to '1' to allow subsequent requests to execute even though the DummyJSON demo API does not persist created items.
    
- Adjust {{token}} in the 'DummyJSON - QA' environment if your API variant requires authentication.
    

## Related Requests

- Login (for obtaining/refreshing token)
    
- Update Product
    
- Delete Product
    
- Search Product By id

request.description:
# Purpose

Update an existing product's attributes in the DummyJSON QA API.

## Endpoint and Method

- Method: PUT
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/products/{{productId}}
    

## Path Variables

- productId (from active environment): ID of the product to update.
    

## Authentication

- Inherit/Use existing auth configuration for this request/collection.
    
- If using a bearer token, environment variable reference: {{token}}.
    

## Required/Recommended Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    
- Accept: application/json
    

## Request Body

- Type: raw JSON
    
- "title": { "type": "string" }, "price": { "type": "number" }, "description": { "type": "string" }, "discountPercentage": { "type": "number" }, "rating": { "type": "number" }, "stock": { "type": "integer" }, "brand": { "type": "string" }, "category": { "type": "string" }
    
    },  
    "additionalProperties": true  
    }
    
- Example Body (matches current tab):  
    {  
    "title": "Celular de Teste QA - ATUALIZADO"  
    }
    

## Success Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Body (example):  
    {  
    "id": 1,  
    "title": "Celular de Teste QA - ATUALIZADO",  
    "description": "...",  
    "price": 29000.99,  
    "discountPercentage": 0,  
    "rating": 0,  
    "stock": 100,  
    "brand": "...",  
    "category": "..."  
    }
    

## Error Responses (examples)

- 400 Bad Request  
    {  
    "error": "Invalid payload",  
    "details": \[
    
    ```
                { "field": "title", "message": "must be a string" }
    
     ```
    
    \]  
    }
    
- 401 Unauthorized  
    {  
    "error": "Missing or invalid token"  
    }
    
- 404 Not Found  
    {  
    "error": "Product not found",  
    "productId": "{{productId}}"  
    }
    

## Notes

- Variables used: {{baseUrl}}, {{productId}}, {{token}} (read-only in this doc). Do not modify variables here; manage them in the active environment "DummyJSON - QA".
    
- This request includes post-response tests that validate status 200, check the product schema, and assert that the title is updated to "Celular de Teste QA - ATUALIZADO".
    
- When running via Collection Runner/Monitor, ensure the environment provides valid values for baseUrl, productId, and token.

request.description:
# Summary  
Deletes a product by its unique identifier. This operation marks the product as deleted and returns metadata about the deletion.

## Endpoint and Method

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/products/{{productId}}
    

## Path and Required Variables

- Path parameters:
    - productId (required): The ID of the product to delete.
        - Example: 123
            
- Environment/collection variables used:
    - baseUrl: Base URL of the API.
        - Example: [https://api.example.com](https://api.example.com)
            
    - token: Bearer token used for authentication.
        - Example: eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...
            

## Authentication

- Type: Bearer Token
    
- Header: Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
    
- The request must be sent with a valid token; otherwise, it will be rejected.
    

## Expected Success Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Body: JSON object containing deletion details.
    
- Schema overview:
    - id: integer
        
    - title: string
        
    - isDeleted: boolean (true when deletion succeeds)
        
    - deletedOn: string (ISO-8601 date/time as string)
        

## Possible Error Responses

- 400 Bad Request: Invalid or missing productId.
    
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing or invalid Authorization header/bearer token.
    
- 403 Forbidden: Authenticated but not authorized to delete the product.
    
- 404 Not Found: Product with the given productId does not exist.
    
- 409 Conflict: Deletion conflict (e.g., product locked or already deleted depending on API behavior).
    
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unhandled server error.
    

## Example cURL

``` bash
curl --location --request DELETE "{{baseUrl}}/products/{{productId}}" \
  --header "Authorization: Bearer {{token}}"

 ```

## Notes

- This request has no body.
    
- Existing tests validate status 200 and check the deletion contract and flags in the response.

request.description:
# Purpose: Retrieve a single product by its ID from DummyJSON.

## Method: GET

## Path: {{baseUrl}}/products/{{productId}}

- Variables in path:
    - baseUrl: Base API URL (from active environment)
        
    - productId: Numeric ID of the product to fetch
        

## Required Variables:

- baseUrl (environment)
    
- productId (environment)
    
- token (environment, if your API requires Bearer auth; this request currently has no explicit auth configured and may inherit from parent)
    

## Authentication:

- Inherit from parent (collection/folder) or none if not configured. If Bearer is needed, set token in environment and configure auth at the folder/collection level.
    

## Success Response (200) overview:

- JSON object with these notable fields
    - id (integer)
        
    - title (string)
        
    - description (string)
        
    - price (number)
        
    - discountPercentage (number)
        
    - rating (number)
        
    - stock (integer)
        
    - brand (string)
        
    - category (string)
        

## Tests:

- Verifies HTTP 200 and validates response against a product schema.
    

## Example usage:

- Set environment variables:
    - baseUrl=[https://dummyjson.com](https://dummyjson.com)
        
    - productId=1
        
- Send request: GET {{baseUrl}}/products/{{productId}}

request.description:
# Summary  
Creates a new user in the DummyJSON service.

## Endpoint and Method  
POST {{baseUrl}}/users/add

## Path and Query Parameters

- Path params: none
    
- Query params: none
    

## Headers

- Content-Type: application/json (implied by raw JSON body)
    

## Authorization

- Inherits any auth from parent folder/collection. If using a bearer token, refer to the environment variable `{{token}}` (if configured). This request does not set auth explicitly.
    

## Request Body

- Type: application/json (raw)
    
- Schema (informal)  
    {  
    firstName: string (required),  
    lastName: string (required),  
    age: number (required),  
    email: string (required),  
    username: string (required),  
    password: string (required)  
    }
    
- Example  
    {  
    "firstName": "Christian",  
    "lastName": "QA Tester",  
    "age": 30,  
    "email": "[christian.qa@exemplo.com](https://mailto:christian.qa@exemplo.com)",  
    "username": "christianqa",  
    "password": "123"  
    }
    
## Response Examples

- 201 Created (latest successful response)  
    {  
    "id": 209,  
    "firstName": "Christian",  
    "lastName": "QA Tester",  
    "maidenName": "",  
    "age": 30,  
    "gender": "",  
    "email": "[christian.qa@exemplo.com](https://mailto:christian.qa@exemplo.com)",  
    "phone": "",  
    "username": "christianqa",  
    "password": "123",  
    "birthDate": "",  
    "image": "",  
    "bloodGroup": "",  
    "height": null,  
    "weight": null,  
    "eyeColor": "",  
    "hair": {"color": "", "type": ""},  
    "ip": "",  
    "address": {
    
    ```
    "address": "",
    "city": "",
    "state": "",
    "stateCode": "",
    "postalCode": "",
    "coordinates": {"lat": null, "lng": null},
    "country": ""
    
     ```
    
    },  
    "macAddress": "",  
    "university": "",  
    "bank": {
    
    ```
    "cardExpire": "",
    "cardNumber": "",
    "cardType": "",
    "currency": "",
    "iban": ""
    
     ```
    
    },  
    "company": {
    
    ```
    "department": "",
    "name": "",
    "title": "",
    "address": {
      "address": "",
      "city": "",
      "state": "",
      "stateCode": "",
      "postalCode": "",
      "coordinates": {"lat": null, "lng": null},
      "country": ""
    }
    
     ```
    
    },  
    "ein": "",  
    "ssn": "",  
    "userAgent": "",  
    "crypto": {"coin": "", "wallet": "", "network": ""},  
    "role": "user"  
    }
    

## Tests (Post-response Script Behavior)

- Verifies status code is 200 or 201.
    
- Validates response body against user schema: object with required fields id (integer), firstName (string), lastName (string), email (string).
    
- Asserts that firstName equals "Christian".
    
- If an id is present, logs it and sets environment variable userId to "1" for downstream flow.
    

## Environment Variables Used

- {{baseUrl}} in the URL (active environment: "DummyJSON - QA").
    
- {{token}} may be used for auth if configured at a higher level (not explicitly set here).
    

## Notes

- Ensure {{baseUrl}} points to the DummyJSON API host.
    
- Update the request body values as needed; tests currently assert firstName = "Christian".
    
- This request has no saved examples; consider saving the latest 201 response as an example for mock/Docs.

request.description:
# Purpose  
Update an existing user‚Äôs profile data.

## Endpoint  
PUT {{baseUrl}}/users/{{userId}}

- Variables:
    - baseUrl: from active environment (e.g., [https://dummyjson.com](https://dummyjson.com))
        
    - userId: numeric or string identifier of the user to update
        

## Method  
PUT

## Auth

- Typically none for DummyJSON demo API.
    
- If your backend requires auth, inherit or add Bearer token at the folder/collection level. This request currently has no explicit auth set.
    

## Required Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    

## Request Body

- Mode: raw (JSON)
    
- Schema (partial, only send fields you want to update):  
    {  
    firstName?: string,  
    lastName?: string,  
    email?: string,  
    age?: number,  
    gender?: "male" | "female" | string,  
    address?: {
    
    ```
    address?: string,
    city?: string,
    state?: string,
    postalCode?: string
    
     ```
    
    }  
    }
    

## Example Body  
{  
"lastName": "Sperb"  
}

## Successful Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Returns the updated user object.
    
- Example:  
    {  
    "id": 1,  
    "firstName": "Emily",  
    "lastName": "Sperb",  
    "email": "[emily.johnson@x.dummyjson.com](https://mailto:emily.johnson@x.dummyjson.com)",  
    "age": 29,  
    "address": { "address": "626 Main Street", "city": "Phoenix" }  
    // ...other fields from the user resource  
    }
    

## Error Responses (examples)

- 400 Bad Request: invalid payload  
    {  
    "message": "Invalid request body"  
    }
    
- 404 Not Found: unknown userId  
    {  
    "message": "User not found"  
    }
    
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden (if your API requires auth)  
    {  
    "message": "Unauthorized"  
    }
    

## Test Hints

- Verify status code is 200.
    
- Assert that response contains expected properties (e.g., firstName, lastName).
    
- Assert that lastName equals the value sent in the request body.
    

## Notes

- This request uses variables {{baseUrl}} and {{userId}} from the active environment/collection. Ensure they are set before sending.
    
- Only fields provided in the body will be updated. Do not include immutable fields like id.

request.description:
# Purpose  
Deletes a user by ID (logical delete) from the DummyJSON service. The operation marks the user as deleted rather than removing the record, returning deletion metadata.

## Endpoint and Variables

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/users/{{userId}}
    
- Path/Env variables:
    - {{baseUrl}} (env): Base API URL (e.g., [https://dummyjson.com](https://dummyjson.com))
        
    - {{userId}} (env): Numeric ID of the user to delete
        

## Authentication

- If the API requires auth, set an auth token in the active environment variable {{token}} and configure Authorization at the collection/folder/request level as needed. This request currently has no explicit auth set and may inherit from parent.
    

## Expected Request

- No request body.
    
- Typical headers: Accept: application/json
    

## Expected Response

- Success: 200 OK with JSON body describing the user and deletion flags.
    
- Key fields used by tests:
    - id: number
        
    - isDeleted: boolean (true when deletion succeeds)
        
    - deletedOn: string (ISO timestamp of logical delete)
        

## Schema (validated in tests)  
{  
"type": "object",  
"required": \["id", "isDeleted", "deletedOn"\],  
"properties": {  
"id": { "type": "integer" },  
"isDeleted": { "type": "boolean" },  
"deletedOn": { "type": "string" }  
}  
}

## Post-response Tests Present

- "Contrato: Resposta de Dele√ß√£o v√°lida": Validates the response JSON schema above.
    
- "Usu√°rio deletado logicamente": Asserts jsonData.isDeleted === true.
    
- Additional tests observed in past runs (workspace-level/parent):
    - Performance: response time below 2s (passed)
        
    - Status code is 200 or 201 (passed)
        

## Last Successful Response (reference)  
Status: 200  
Body excerpt:  
{  
"id": 1,  
...,  
"isDeleted": true,  
"deletedOn": "2025-12-12T08:42:17.007Z"  
}

## Success and Error Cases

- 200 OK: User logically deleted. isDeleted should be true and deletedOn present.
    
- 404 Not Found: {{userId}} does not exist.
    
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden: Missing or invalid auth when the API requires it.
    
- 400 Bad Request: Invalid {{userId}} (non-numeric or malformed).
    

## How to Use / Examples

1) Set env variables in "DummyJSON - QA":

- baseUrl = [https://dummyjson.com](https://dummyjson.com)
    
- userId =
    
- token =  
    2) Send the request. Verify tests:
    
- Schema validation passes.
    
- isDeleted equals true.  
    3) Optional: Save a response example after a successful delete to assist mock servers/documentation.
    

## Notes

- This is a logical delete; user data may still be returned with isDeleted = true and a deletion timestamp.
    
- Request has no body and relies entirely on the path variable {{userId}}.

exec: pm.test("Performance: Tempo de resposta abaixo de 2s", function () {
